metadata.title: CVE-2024-43884 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:Bluetooth: MGMT: Add error handling to pair_device()hci_conn_params_add() never checks for a NULL value and could lead to aNULLpointer dereference causing a crash.Fixed by adding error handling in the function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-43884` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-262-generic - 4.4.0-262.296~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-262-generic - 4.4.0-262.296~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-262-lowlatency - 4.4.0-262.296~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1139-aws - 4.4.0-1139.145
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-262.296~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1139.145').
linux-azure package in trusty is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1184.199~14.04.1').
